content: rabbit a free design by susan b anderson ™ ™ www spudandchloe com sweet yarns for real life ™ materials us size 5 double pointed needles set of 4 or size to obtain gauge yarn needle scissors tape measure or ruler polyester fiber fill small amount tennis ball optional black embroidery floss stitch marker stitch holder or waste yarn abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together m1 make a stitch by placing the bar between the stitches on the left needle and knitting it through the back loop kfb knit in the front and back of the same stitch st s stitch es round s round s body starting at the bottom of the body with ice cream and the double- pointed needles cast on 9 stitches placing 3 stitches on each of 3 double-pointed needles join towork in the round being careful not to twist the stitches place a stitch marker on the first stitch round 1 knit round 2 k1 m1 k1 m1 k1 repeat to the end of the round 5 sts per needle 15 sts total round 3 knit yarn round 4 k1 m1 knit to the last stitch on the needle m1 k1 repeat spud & chloë sweater 55% superwash wool 45 % organic on each needle cotton 160 yards/100grams 1 skein in ice cream #7500 round 5 knit repeat rounds 4 and 5 until there are 15 stitches on each needle 45 stitches total finished measurements end with a round 4 place a stitch marker on the last completed 3 inches wide by 7 inches tall round and leave it there knit every round until the body measures 1 ½ inches above the gauge stitch marker 6 stitches per inch in stockinette stitch decrease rounds round 1 k3 k2tog repeat to the end of the round 12 sts per needle 36 sts total remain round 2 k2 k2tog repeat to the end of the round 9 sts per needle 27 sts total remain © 2012 this pattern is copyrighted material and under the copyright laws of the united states you may use this pattern for your own personal use or enjoyment but may not edit publish copy or commercially exploit this pattern in any way spud and chloë and the spud and chloë characters are trademarks and copyrights of blue sky alpacas increase 013012 rabbit a free design by susan b anderson ™ ™ www spudandchloe com/blog sweet yarns for real life ™ at this point place the end from the cast on stitches on a yarn round 8 k3 k2tog on each needle 12 sts remain needle gather up andclose the hole at the cast on end of the round 9 k2 k2tog on each needle 9 sts remain body pull the end to the inside and trim cut the yarn and pull through the remaining stitches pull up tight to close the hole and take a few stitches to secure pull the end to the now is the time
